page.title: 13LEISURE IN BRENTFORD
page.content: Pleasure{boating}is more important than commercial transport on Brentford's waterways. The{swimming baths were opened in 1896. The baths are not used much because there are no diving boards or infant facilities. Brentford{Football}Club was founded in 1889 by the Thames Rowing Club who wanted another activity in the winter. They moved onto the present site in 1904. The ground was leased from Fuller's Brewery. Brentford is now in the 3rd Division but was in the 1st Division from 1928 to 1936. Their best season was in 1936 when they came fifth in the League, and in 1985 they got to Wembley in the final of the Freight Rover Trophy for 3rd and 4th Division Clubs.The Club has a variety of teams: First team, reserve team, two youth teams, under 18, under 17 and a schoolboys' team.
